content.description: Long and pumpy route with multiple cruxes and too many rests
Sweet technical climbing up a nice arete, using some pretty sick holds. Nice and Long.
content.location: Left of Party In My Pants

content.description: Pumpy climbing on good holds will get you very excited.
content.location: From Danks main wall go left a couple of minutes

content.description: An ugly start leads to sexy climbing that gets better looking with altitude! Way fun!
content.protection: Lots of quickdraws. This is one long, involved route with bolts that seem a long way apart but aren't so bad once you figure out the movement.
content.location: Middle of the Danks. Right hand most route on The Party Wall.

content.protection:
Belayers beware! Your climber might take some long rides on this route if they imbebe much more than they can handle.  

  Park yourself in front of the pillar with the crack in it not to far up from the main trail and hope your climber is a light weight! 

  Take a dozen draws.

content.description: The Party Wall is located approximately in the middle of The Danks. It is typically accessed by using the trail that is located just across the road from the parking lot. For those of you having trouble finding this trail (which is not in the guidebook) walk over to the power box with all the stickers on it and then walk to the ditch across the road. Stay to the left of a large boulder, walk up the hill, and you should reach the traverse trail in less than five minutes. The Party Wall is just to the right of The Blowin' Kisses Wall.
